009package ImageJ_Demos;
010
011import ij.ImagePlus;
012import ij.plugin.filter.PlugInFilter;
013import ij.process.ImageProcessor;
014
015/**
016 * This ImageJ plugin shows how data can be communicated from one
017 * plugin to another. In this example, THIS plugin ({@link Data_Transfer_Plugin_Producer})
018 * calculates a histogram that is subsequently retrieved by ANOTHER
019 * plugin {@link Data_Transfer_Plugin_Consumer}. 
020 * Data are stored as a <strong>property</strong> of the associated image (of type {@link ImagePlus}).
021 * Note that the stored data should contain no instances of self-defined
022 * classes, since these may be re-loaded when performing compile-and-run.
023 * 
024 * @author WB
025 *
026 */
027public class Data_Transfer_Plugin_Producer implements PlugInFilter {
028        
029        // Create a unique (publicly visible) property key:
030        public static final String HistKey = 
031                        Data_Transfer_Plugin_Producer.class.getCanonicalName() + "histogram";
032        
033        ImagePlus im;
034        
035        public int setup(String arg, ImagePlus im) {
036                this.im = im;
037                return DOES_ALL + NO_CHANGES;}
038                
039        public void run(ImageProcessor ip) {
040                int[] hist = ip.getHistogram();
041                // add histogram to image properties:
042                im.setProperty(HistKey, hist);
043        }
044}
